{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with irregular periods, severe facial acne, dense black hairs on specific areas of her face and neck, and ultrasound findings of bilateral enlarged ovaries with multiple cysts. These findings are consistent with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). PCOS is associated with hormonal imbalances, specifically increased levels of androgens. One of the potential complications of PCOS is an increased risk of endometrial carcinoma. Therefore, the patient is most likely at an increased risk of developing endometrial carcinoma.", "answer_choice": "A"}
